options.title: --[no-]user-install
options.description: Uninstall from user’s home directory in addition to GEM_HOME.

options.title: --[no-]format-executable
options.description: Assume executable names match Ruby’s prefix and suffix.

options.title: --[no-]force
options.description: Uninstall all versions of the named gems ignoring dependencies

options.description: Prevent uninstalling gems that are depended on by other gems.

options.description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem as update targets

options.title: -i, --install-dir DIR
options.description: Gem repository directory to get installed gems

options.description: Gem repository directory to get installed gems

options.title: -n, --bindir DIR
options.description: Directory where executables will be placed when the gem is installed

options.description: Directory where executables will be placed when the gem is installed

options.title: --document [TYPES]
options.description: Generate documentation for installed gems List the documentation types you wish to generate. For example: rdoc,ri

options.title: --build-root DIR
options.description: Temporary installation root. Useful for building packages. Do not use this when installing remote gems.

options.title: --vendor
options.description: Install gem into the vendor directory. Only for use by gem repackagers.

options.title: -E, --[no-]env-shebang
options.description: Rewrite the shebang line on installed scripts to use /usr/bin/env

options.title: -E, --[no-]env-shebang
options.description: Rewrite the shebang line on installed scripts to use /usr/bin/env

options.title: -f, --[no-]force
options.description: Force gem to install, bypassing dependency checks

options.description: Force gem to install, bypassing dependency checks

options.title: -w, --[no-]wrappers
options.description: Use bin wrappers for executables Not available on dosish platforms

options.title: -w, --[no-]wrappers
options.description: Use bin wrappers for executables Not available on dosish platforms

options.title: --ignore-dependencies
options.description: Do not install any required dependent gems

options.title: --[no-]format-executable
options.description: Make installed executable names match Ruby. If Ruby is ruby18, foo_exec will be foo_exec18

options.title: --[no-]user-install
options.description: Install in user’s home directory instead of GEM_HOME.

options.title: --development-all
options.description: Install development dependencies for all gems (including dev deps themselves)

options.title: --conservative
options.description: Don’t attempt to upgrade gems already meeting version requirement

options.title: --[no-]minimal-deps
options.description: Don’t upgrade any dependencies that already meet version requirements

options.title: -g, --file [FILE]
options.description: Read from a gem dependencies API file and install the listed gems

options.title: -g, --file [FILE]
options.description: Read from a gem dependencies API file and install the listed gems

options.title: --without GROUPS
options.description: Omit the named groups (comma separated) when installing from a gem dependencies file

options.title: --default
options.description: Add the gem’s full specification to specifications/default and extract only its bin

options.title: --explain
options.description: Rather than install the gems, indicate which would be installed

options.title: --[no-]lock
options.description: Create a lock file (when used with -g/–file)

options.title: --[no-]suggestions
options.description: Suggest alternates when gems are not found
